alert.note: Alert for Surprise Valley California (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 9:35AM PST until December 27 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow diminishing this afternoon. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Wind gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Surprise Valley California, Greater Reno-Carson City- Minden Area and Northern Washoe County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel remains very difficult today. Most roads in the Sierra are closed and sections of Highway 395 are closed due to whiteout conditions. Winds will continue to produce snow drifts and whiteout conditions in some areas.
info.instruction: Expect major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
